hero.description: I condensed the DNA of the main 3D configurator into three ultra-focused experiences. Goal: let users create a standard piece in under a minute while keeping personalization maxed out.

context.title: Context
paragraphs: The historical configurator is a precision beast but not always suited for recurring requests.
I started by experimenting on the simple cabinet, then on more complex furniture like staircases and projector consoles.
For each configurator I aimed at an ultra-guided experience: step-by-step flow, minimalist canvas, smart fields, and a viewer that changes in real time.
Extremely guided interfaces: you advance step by step through dimensions, materials, options, etc. while the 3D viewer stays updated.
Result: the user can only progress after validating each step and builds the furniture in under a minute. Perfect for non-technical or mobile clients.
This approach was designed with the team’s Designer, involved across the whole process.

hero.description: MCP (Model Context Protocol) server letting an LLM craft furniture like a human advisor from client text or sketches.

highlight.title: Flagship project
paragraphs: Goal: let clients obtain furniture without touching the configurator—the AI handles it all. From text or sketch, the LLM reasons, calls several tools to build then adjust the project, and finally reports back.
Tested first with Claude and ChatGPT, now embedded in the site and used by clients. Security is crucial: only legit users can access the AI (costs rise fast otherwise).

hero.description: Web app that charts optimized itineraries across the Star Wars galaxy. Modular architecture: C + Java + PHP + JS + database collaborating like a rebel crew. The C-built A* algorithm finds the quickest path between planets.

overview.title: overview
paragraphs: Travia explores how C, Java, PHP, JavaScript modules plus a MySQL database can collaborate toward one goal: ultra-fast routes between planetary systems.

Leaflet maps the Star Wars galaxy while the C-built A* algorithm computes optimal paths. Java orchestrates MySQL data and recalls each station in perfect order. PHP manages user sessions and the REST API, with captcha and email verification.

cards.title: Web server
cards.description: Gateway distributing requests between modules. Every call passes here before heading to Java graph processing.

cards.title: Leaflet interface
cards.description: Interactive canvas to browse the galaxy and pull info per planet. Pure JS + Leaflet keeps the map fluid.

cards.title: Java + MySQL
cards.description: JDBC modules feed the interplanetary graph, compute heuristics, and send clean data to the C algorithm.

cards.title: A* algorithm
cards.description: Implemented in C for max speed. Results return to the server, which turns them into readable routes and overlays.

cards.title: User management
cards.description: Account creation, login, recovery + captcha + email verification: a secure workflow so every rebel can save routes without the Empire snooping.

learnings.title: key learnings
items: Compose a multi-language architecture without friction and keep data flowing.
Optimize an A* path in C with a heuristic-first mindset.
Create immersive map + overlay interfaces in JS with Leaflet.
Design a Java backend handling graph processing.
Set up user security with captcha and verification emails.

hero.description: Multiplayer Wikipedia speedrun, fully in-browser. Start from one page, get a list of targets, and chain links to reach them. Meanwhile the WebSocket server processes moves, the proxy rewrites pages, and the UI rocks a Windows 95 vibe.

concept.title: concept
paragraphs: A frantic duel: each player clicks internal Wikipedia links until they reach every target page. Each action is pushed via WebSocket to the server running the full game logic.
Players can grab positive or negative items and use them to slow down opponents.
A built-in chat keeps everyone talking mid-race.

cards.title: WebSocket server
cards.description: Instant interactions, synced races, live scoreboard. The server drives the speedrun tempo.

cards.title: Wikipedia proxy
cards.description: Express + Axios + CORS rewrite wiki pages on the fly and inject link tracking into the front layer.

cards.title: Git cadence

learnings.title: learnings
items: Build solid real-time comms for a multiplayer game.
Handle Git conflicts and ship clear PRs.
Industrialize an HTTP proxy that rewrites pages.
